title: How to raise elo
body:
So how exactly do I climb and raise elo if my teammates constantly lose? (this isn't my main account)
Now, before you say I'm the classic bronzie blaming his team, i'm not (silver in my main) Honestly, 95% of the time, I win my lane (mid) and usually crush my enemy mid laner. I roam and help other lanes as well but they keep dying/feeding/complaining to the point where i can't do anything about it. From having a very good kda in laning phase, it deteriorates as the game progresses and we end up losing because of shitty bot/top. Ev For some reason between 0-15 mins of the game during laning phase before I can start roaming all my other lanes somehow get crushed so hard that the enemy team is so fed and we lose. I understand kda doesn't help u win games (objectives,etc.) but we can't contest them just cos the enemy is so far ahead. Now, in normals this is kinda an on and off situation but literally every ranked game after placements no matter how hard i win my lane other lanes just fuck up and we get crushed, which leads to me getting a bad kda, lower mmr and a never ending cycle. So how do I fix this? I want to play ranked but im afraid my next game same thing will happen and ill get demoted.

Hey mate,

I'm happy to give you some more specific feedback if you want, but a search on "gr8m8er" didn't show any ranked history (just some bot games).

However if you are looking to improve (and off the back of that climb MMR) there are some great resources out there;

First up check out these 2 great posts by our Instructor;

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/E5KPW5Qx-playing-like-a-god-but-still-cant-climb-part-1

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/xeKp58HJ-playing-like-a-god-but-still-cant-climb-part-2

Also I always highly suggest checking out these videos. Its great to see you are open to advice in your journey. I'll talk about two things to try and help you on the Ranked Ladder. Your game play and how to improve and your attitude towards the game.

I'm going to start with attitude first because I believe this is one of the most important things to get right before you can improve and climb fast. 

**Attitude**
When you are playing Ranked focus on your own game play, never look to push blame onto others. Unless you are literally Faker then there are probably things you could have done better to put your team in a position to win. Check out this video from Gbay99 - https://youtu.be/5MTO2a7ZFcc

Always stay positive, if you don't have something nice to say don't say it. If you are negative in your team chat not only will you add fire to the fuel but you could also potentially start your team on a downward spiral to fighting each other in chat instead of playing the game and trying to win. Remember League of Legends is a team game you have to work together as a team to win. #TeamWorkOP - https://youtu.be/ugXC7g3p0JU

**Gameplay**
You've only just started on your ranked journey, there is going to be a lot to learn (hell I've played for 4 years and still have lots to learn). Don't get discouraged by losses and make sure you learn something from every death (why did you die? were you out of position? misjudged damage of opponent? etc) and make sure you always continue to learn about the game. There is a lot more to this game than just csing and fighting champions.

Check out this sick play list from UNSW LoL Society - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9RdXhXESRJzgY_SwHB8T-cZxXljWhQvz

It will teach you a lot about trading in lane, lane control, team fighting, and also how to use a lead.

Hope this all helps and good luck on the Rift!

You guys scare me about doing my ranked placements as a support main. I mean I feel like I'm bronze 2 or 3 but I'm 90% sure I'll end up in bronze 5 and never be able to leave.

The Ranked climb is tough and rewarding at the same time. As long as you go into it with the right mind set (self improvement etc) then you will have overall a good time.

I've been playing ranked for years now and there are always times where I hate this game and love this game at the same time. Playing ranked games is one of the most rewarding experiences for me, its taught me a tonne about not only the game but the kind of mindset and attitude you need to have for life in general.

Only one other experience has been more enjoyable for me (as a super competitive player) and that is when you play on a semi serious Ranked 5s teams. That is by far IMO THE best experience in League of Legends.

"And rewarding"

No not really.

500 games in and it was rewarding at first when i placed b1 and was like "yeah lets keep climbing" tilted my way down  to b3 stayed there for awhile, got reset to b5 in S6 (pls no)

been stuck here ever since just bashing my head against the proverbial wall.

Every win is bitter sweet because "yep knew i was gonna win"

and "pointless anyway because im getting -2 mmr per win or something"

At my current win rate ill have fixed my overall winrate in about a month.

My projections put me at b5 0lp with a 50% winrate

Why? because im getting no goddamn mmr so there is no progression to speak of.

Actually there will be one thing i enjoy.

Rubbing it in peoples faces when i have a 51% winrate that im still not climbing.

And proving that they are all fucking stupid for thinking "oh yeah you have a 47% winrate thats why you dont climb get to 50%"

the placement itself is nothing to be worried about, i played with mid/low golds and high silvers and got placed silver 4 in my euw account.
what u should be worried about is the matchmaking after that. after doing my placements i checked my mmr on op.gg and they said its higher than normal. well thats bs cos i lost every ranked game after placements, got demoted to silver 5, got my mmr lowered and now im just not gonna play ranked cos ill just keep losing and go to bronze
I should also mention i got paired with a bronze 3 right after placements despite having a 'higher than avg' mmr

Yeah I mentioned this isn't my main account (i play on euw)
Also im low elo (silver) so teamwork isn't an option e.g one time we aced the enemy team and instead of getting a free baron/dragon our team literally did nothing but farm no matter how much i told them we need to push with baron adv.

I think the key thing here is to just make sure you are sportsmanlike towards your team. Players make the wrong play all the time it isn't limited to silver or bronze. The only way a team can win/lose is off of good plays and mistakes, it happens even in High plat/Diamond where I play.

As long as you have the right mindset towards improving and then take into account the learning opportunities out there like the UNSWLoL soc tutorials I posted there is huge opportunities to climb.

I actually highly recommend watching that gameplay series by the UNSW LoL soc, watching all their video's helped be breakthrough from gold/plat to plat/diamond. I still can learn things by rewatching the videos and making sure I apply what they are teaching.
Understand and play the game well enough to not require a team.
